p: “Many people with hepatitis B and C infections show no obvious symptoms, so the disease often goes undiagnosed,” says Erika Duffell, an epidemiologist at the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) in Stockholm, and an author of Hepatitis B/C in the countries of the European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA): a systematic review of the prevalence among at-risk groups, published in February in BMC infectious diseases.
